author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
I was in Dunkirk a few years back at the same time as a veteran’s reunion.
We got talking to some of the men in a bar and the story was incredible, how when one of the ships near shore was mined one of the chaps, who was lying on the beach at the time trying to sleep, was lifted clear of the sand by the force of the blast.
He was on the beach for a couple of days, waiting to be evacuated whilst there was carnage going on all around.

author: Rick Spilman
content: Thanks. We will post about it on the anniversary of the loss.

author: Chris Roche
content: Dont forget that two weeks after the success at Dunkirk on 17 June 1940 the mail liner RMT LANCASTRIA was lost at St Nazaire causing the worst loss of life in British Maritime History more than 4000 died in her more than in the TITANIC and LUSITANIA added together, in the few days around that time a further 225.000 plus were brought out a little spoken about incident my father was a survivor from RMT LANCASTRIA.
